snippet: The remains of hundreds of Chinese soldiers killed in the Korean War may finally return home, 60 years after an armistice ended the fighting.
abstract: South Korea's Pres Park Geun-hye, during visit to China, offers to send back remains of about 360 Chinese soldiers killed in Korean War; offer is seen as friendly gesture highlighting  warming ties between former adversaries.
lead_paragraph: The remains of hundreds of Chinese soldiers killed in the Korean War may finally return home, 60 years after an armistice ended the fighting.

headline.main: South Korea: Offer to Return Remains of Chinese Troops Killed in Korean War
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Offer to Return Remains Of Chinese Troops Killed in Korean War
